intro: Poikilogyne, commonly known as the variable leaf orchid, is a unique plant species characterized by its highly variable leaf morphology. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions with high humidity. The plant exhibits a range of leaf shapes and sizes, which can vary significantly even within the same population. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying vibrant colors to attract pollinators. Due to its adaptability, Poikilogyne is considered an interesting subject for botanical research.
